Zooms.Description: A plan must be prepared for the implementation of decisions. The plan must include milestones and deadlines for when the implementation shall be completed.

Fields.Name: title
Fields.Label: Title
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter the title of the assessment
Fields.Description: This field defines the title of the assessment. It should include important information relevant to the subject for the assessment. This could for example be information related to physical location, activity, object, organisational unit, project or type of assessment. Example: Risk assessment of activity xxx at location zzz.

Fields.Name: objective
Fields.Label: Objective
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter the objective for the assessment
Fields.Description: This field describes key information related to the purpose and objective for the assessment. A risk assessment is primarily performed to be able to make decisions that increase safety and avoid losses. Example: To evaluate the risk related to the activity xxxx in order to conduct the operation in safe manner.

Fields.Name: assumptions
Fields.Label: Main Assumptions
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter the main assumptions for the assessment
Fields.Description: This field describes the main assumptions relevant for the assessment. In addition to these main assumptions, specific assumptions relevant for each hazard will be described later.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Label: Detailed Description
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter a detailed description of the assessment
Fields.Description: This field describes a detailed description of the subject for the risk assessment. This field should include a description of the scope of the assessment, as well as the depth / breadth of the assessment and important inclusions / exclusions.  It should also be determined who the stakeholders are, to ensure the analysis can provide decision support.

Zooms.Description:
Workshop.

A risk assessment is often performed in a workshop where personnel with relevant competence participates. Prior to this workshop, it can be beneficial to invite relevant personnel to provide input by entering concerns (risks) related to the planned risk assessment. Where concerns are returned prior to the workshop, they appear directly as risks in this assessment. This provides the organiser with pre-meeting input and improves the ability to prepare the risk assessment.

By entering participants, date and time for the workshop, a message describing the background for the workshop and a date for the e-mail invitation to be sent, the participants will receive an e-mail invitation to the workshop, including a link to a form where concerns can be provided and the inviation can be accepted or declined. The e-mail invitation includes the risk assessment title, objective, detailed description and main assumptions previously entered.

Fields.Name: e_responsible_unit_ids
Fields.Label: Unit
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter organisational unit owning the assessment
Fields.Description: Several organisational units in the organisation may be involved in the assessment. This field describes the organisational unit owning the assessment. The organisational unit owning the assessment is normally also responsible for following up the results from the assessment. The organisational unit owning the assessment may or may not be the same as the organisational unit who has initiated/requested the assessment or the organisational unit who is in charge of conducting the assessment.

Fields.Name: e_location_ids
Fields.Label: Location
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter physical location of the subject for the assessment
Fields.Description: This field describes the physical location of the subject for the assessment.

Fields.Name: e_activity_ids
Fields.Label: Activity
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter main activity relevant to the subject for the assessment
Fields.Description: This field describes the main activity relevant to the subject for the assessment. This could for example be a project or a specific operation such as a lifting operation.

Fields.Name: e_risk_category_ids
Fields.Label: Risk Category
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter risk assessment category relevant to the subject and objective for the assessment
Fields.Description: This field describes the risk category relevant to the subject and objective for the assessment. This could for example be a strategic, operational or financial risk assessment.

Fields.Name: e_projectowner_ids
Fields.Label: Assessment Owner
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter risk assessment owner
Fields.Description:
This is the person responsible for following up the assessment.
If you can not find a person in the list, you can add him / her as a new user. The new user will have access to My UXRisk for follow-up of his / her allocated measures. If you want the person to also be able to use this UXRisk APP and have access to your organisation's data, please choose 'yes' in response to the question in the panel.

Fields.Name: e_status_ids
Fields.Label: Status
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a status
Fields.Description: An assessment is automatically set to draft when a new assessment is generated. In order for the assessment to be active and visible in the risk hierarchy, the status must be set to open. A prerequisite for this is that the risk assessment owner is defined. An assessment can only be closed when all measures have been completed or cancelled and you are no longer exposed to the risks which are therefore closed. It is possible to retrieve all assessments independently of their status.

Fields.Name: e_phase_ids
Fields.Label: Phase
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter phases relevant for this assessment
Fields.Description: Phases are used to structure the risk assessment and should be generated based on the scope and objective of the assessment. All concerns entered by workshop participants will be tagged as 'Concerns'.

Zooms.Description: Describing the context is an important part of the risk assessment. Without a defined objective and a clearly formulated problem, the assessment will often be unfocused and will not give the answers needed in order to make good decisions. Hence, it is important to clearly describe the context for the assessment in terms of defining responsibilities for and within the assessment, identifying decisions to be made based on the assessment and the subject for the assessment. We perform risk assessments to be able to make decisions!

Fields.Name: title
Fields.Label: Risk
Fields.Description: The title of the risk should be a short description of the main aspects of the risk. The risk can be either an opportunity or a threat.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Label: Description
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter a description of the risk
Fields.Description: This field gives a more detailed description of the risk. This is sometimes necessary in order to get a clearer picture of what the risk actually entails. It should be easy to move from overview into seeing the details.

Fields.Name: assumption
Fields.Label: Assumption
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter assumptions for the risk
Fields.Description: This field describes the main assumptions relevant for the risk.

Fields.Name: a_causes_ids
Fields.Label: Causes
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter causes to the risk
Fields.Description: This field describes the direct or underlying cause for the risk. By analysing the causes for the risk it can be evaluated how to prevent initiating risks from occurring.

Fields.Name: a_measures_ids
Fields.Label: Measures
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter risk reducing measures
Fields.Description:
This field describes barriers or measures that may influence / control / mitigate the risk. A barrier or measure may influence:
a) The occurrence/realisation of the threat/opportunity.
b) One or several causes of the threat/opportunity.
c) The consequences if the threat/opportunity should occur/be realised.

Fields.Name: e_consequence_probability_ids
Fields.Label: Probability
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select the probability for the risk
Fields.Description: This field defines the probability for the risk to occur. Historical data and statistics can be used as background information if available. However, often the background data is inadequate. It is important that the probability for the risk is linked to the possible consequence(s) specified.

Fields.Name: e_consequence_safety_ids
Fields.Label: Safety
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a category
Fields.Description:
Define the consequences the risk may lead to in terms of personnel safety. In this context, personnel safety is described by various degrees of personnel injury to death of one or more people.
A consequence can be defined as a quantity that can be measured in the future. The consequences can be defined by different dimensions or attributes; personnel safety, external environmental, working environment, economy and reputation.
Further, a consequence may be positive or negative, based on the reference level it is compared to.
Quite often, several consequences are possible. In this case it is important to show the extent of possible consequences in the risk analysis.

Fields.Name: e_consequence_economy_ids
Fields.Label: Economy
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a category
Fields.Description:
Define the economical consequences the risk may lead to. In this context, the economical consequences are quantified by amount of money lost or gained.
A consequence can be defined as a quantity that can be measured in the future. The consequences can be defined by different dimensions or attributes; personnel safety, external environmental, working environment, economy and reputation.
Further, a consequence may be positive or negative, based on the reference level it is compared to.
Quite often, several consequences are possible. In this case it is important to show the extent of possible consequences in the risk analysis.

Fields.Name: e_consequence_environment_ids
Fields.Label: Environment
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a category
Fields.Description:
Define the consequences the risk may lead to in terms of damage to the external environment. In this context, damage to the external environment is based on discharge of harmful substances.
A consequence can be defined as a quantity that can be measured in the future. The consequences can be defined by different dimensions or attributes; personnel safety, external environmental, working environment, economy and reputation.
Further, a consequence may be positive or negative, based on the reference level it is compared to.
Quite often, several consequences are possible. In this case it is important to show the extent of possible consequences in the risk analysis.

Fields.Name: e_consequence_working_environment_ids
Fields.Label: Working environment
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a category
Fields.Description:
Define the consequences the risk may lead to for the working environment. In this context, damage to the working environment is based on number of employees resigning.
A consequence can be defined as a quantity that can be measured in the future. The consequences can be defined by different dimensions or attributes; personnel safety, external environmental, working environment, economy and reputation.
Further, a consequence may be positive or negative, based on the reference level it is compared to.
Quite often, several consequences are possible. In this case it is important to show the extent of possible consequences in the risk analysis.

Fields.Name: e_consequence_reputation_ids
Fields.Label: Reputation
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a category
Fields.Description:
Define the consequences the risk may lead to in terms of impact on reputation. In this context, impact on reputation is based on change in reputation towards clients and stakeholders.
A consequence can be defined as a quantity that can be measured in the future. The consequences can be defined by different dimensions or attributes; personnel safety, external environmental, working environment, economy and reputation.
Further, a consequence may be positive or negative, based on the reference level it is compared to.
Quite often, several consequences are possible. In this case it is important to show the extent of possible consequences in the risk analysis.

Fields.Name: e_uncertainty_ids
Fields.Label: Uncertainty
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please define the uncertainty for the risk
Fields.Description:
The uncertainty is related to the occurrence/realisation of the threat/opportunity and the possible consequences/outcomes if the threat/opportunity should occur without any additional measures/actions being implemented. The uncertainty is classified as high if one or more of the conditions below applies:

- Unavailable or unreliable relevant data or experience

- Low level of knowledge of the risk

- Disagreement amongst the experts involved in the analysis

Fields.Name: e_manageability_ids
Fields.Label: Manageability
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a category
Fields.Description:
Manageability is the risk owner's ability to influence or control the threat/opportunity and/or its consequences or outcomes. It is a useful tool when it comes to prioritising mitigation measures in the Risk Mitigation phase. The following categories can be used when classifying manageability:

- High: The risk can be controlled/managed

- Medium: The risk can be influenced

- Low: The risk can not be influenced

Fields.Name: consequence_justification
Fields.Label: Justification for consequence
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter a justification for the selected consequences
Fields.Description: Describe the consequences the initiating risk may lead to. A consequence can be defined as a quantity that can be measured in the future. Further, a consequence may be positive or negative, based on the reference level it is compared against. Quite often, several consequences are possible. In this case it is important to show the extent of possible consequences in the risk analysis. The consequences can be defined by different dimensions or attributes, for example personnel safety, environmental consequences and financial consequences.

Fields.Name: uncertainty_justification
Fields.Label: Justification for uncertainty
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter a justification for the uncertainty
Fields.Description: The background for the classification of the uncertainty should be documented. This is important information when it comes to prioritising risk mitigation.

Fields.Name: vulnerability
Fields.Label: Vulnerability
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter the vulnerability related to the risk
Fields.Description: Vulnerability is an expression of the degree to which a system is susceptible to or impaired by an undesirable event. Also the degree to which the system is unable to accommodate or adjust to the impact to maintain or resume its function when exposed to an undesirable event is an important aspect of vulnerability. Robustness is the opposite of vulnerability.

Fields.Name: e_risk_owner_ids
Fields.Label: Risk owner
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter risk owner
Fields.Description:
This is the person responsible for following up the risk.
If you can not find a person in the list, you can add him / her as a new user. The new user will have access to My UXRisk for follow-up of his / her allocated measures. If you want the person to also be able to use this UXRisk APP and have access to your organisation's data, please choose 'yes' in response to the question in the panel.

Fields.Name: e_status_ids
Fields.Label: Status
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a status
Fields.Description: A risk is automatically set to draft when a new risk is identified. In order for the risk to be active and visible in the risk picture for the assessment in addition to the risk hierarchy, the status must be set to open. A prerequisite for this is that the assessment status is open and the risk owner is defined. A risk can only be closed when all the related measures are completed or cancelled, and you are no longer exposed to this specific risk. It is possible to retrieve all risks independently of their status.

Fields.Name: e_phase_ids
Fields.Label: Phase
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select a phase
Fields.Description: Phases are used to structure the risk assessment and should be generated based on the scope and objective of the assessment. All concerns entered by workshop participants will be tagged as 'Concerns'.

Zooms.Description: Risk Analysis involves developing an understanding of the risk. The risk is analysed by considering the causes and sources of risk, possible positive and negative consequences and the likelihood that those consequences can occur. The focus will depend on why the analysis shall be performed.

Risk Analysis involves developing an understanding of the risk. The risk is analysed by considering the causes and sources of risk, possible positive and negative consequences and the likelihood that those consequences can occur. The focus will depend on why the analysis shall be performed.

Risk Analysis involves developing an understanding of the risk. The risk is analysed by considering the causes and sources of risk, possible positive and negative consequences and the likelihood that those consequences can occur. The focus will depend on why the analysis shall be performed.

Risk Analysis involves developing an understanding of the risk. The risk is analysed by considering the causes and sources of risk, possible positive and negative consequences and the likelihood that those consequences can occur. The focus will depend on why the analysis shall be performed.

An important part of a risk assessment is to identify potential initiating risks. What you can not identify you can not handle, i.e. it is difficult to prevent hazards and threats that have not been identified. Thus, identification of initiating risks is crucial.

Fields.Name: title
Fields.Label: Risk
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter the title of the assessment

Fields.Name: title
Fields.Label: Risk
Fields.Description: This is the risk affected by the measure. For each risk, several measures can be identified, both existing measures and suggestions for new measures.

Fields.Name: title
Fields.Label: Measure
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter the title of the measure
Fields.Description: The title of the measure should be a short description of the main aspects of the measure. The measure can be either an existing measure or a suggestion for a new measure.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Label: Description
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter a description of the measure
Fields.Description: Describe the measure in more detail in order to get a clearer picture of what the measure actually entails and so that everybody taking the text out of context understand it. It is important to describe how the measure affects the risk, e.g. in terms of influencing the probability or consequences. If the measure deals with only one of several causes or consequences, this should be described. Also, the main assumptions used as basis for the assessment of the measure should be described.

Fields.Name: e_measure_category_ids
Fields.Label: Category
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select the category for the measure
Fields.Description: A measure can have several characteristics where whether a measure is operational, organisational or technical is one characteristic. This information can be used to group measures by categories and may provide an important input to evaluating, implementing and following up measures.

Fields.Name: e_responsible_ids
Fields.Label: Responsible
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter person responsible for the measure
Fields.Description:
This is the person responsible for implementing the measure within the given due date.
If you can not find a person in the list, you can add him / her as a new user. The new user will have access to My UXRisk for follow-up of his / her allocated measures. If you want the person to also be able to use this UXRisk APP and have access to your organisation's data, please choose 'yes' in response to the question in the panel.

Fields.Name: e_responsible_unit_ids
Fields.Label: Unit
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter unit responsible for the measure
Fields.Description: This field describes the organisational unit to where the measure belongs. In some cases, it is not possible to define a person or position responsible for the measure. In such cases, it is necessary to at least specify an organisational unit responsible for implementing the measure.

Fields.Name: deadline
Fields.Label: Due date
Fields.PlaceholderText: Select a due date for the measure
Fields.Description: Select a due date for the measure.

Fields.Name: e_costeffect_ids
Fields.Label: Cost/Effect
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please select the cost/effect for the measure
Fields.Description:
The cost-effect is a combination of the cost related to implementing the measure and the risk reducing effect achieved by implementing the measure.

Start by evaluating how the measure may affect the risk, e.g. in terms of reducing the probability for the risk occurring and/or reducing the consequences. The risk reducing effect can qualitatively be categorized in three groups; high, medium and low risk reducing effect. Note that the risk reducing effect should only be categorised as high if the risk without implementing the measure, in terms of the probability and/or consequence, could be categorised as high.

Then, perform a cost estimate for implementing the measure.
Here, four cost categories are used; very low, low, medium and high.

The cost estimate is used together with the risk reducing effect to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of the measure. This can be used to categorise and prioritise measures. The cost-effect categories are based on the principles given below. Based on this categorization, the risk reduction per invested currency unit is highest in the high cost-effect category and lowest in the very low cost-effect category, based on the assumption in the assessment.

High cost-effect
- High risk reducing effect / Very low cost
- Medium risk reducing effect / Very low cost

Medium cost-effect
- High risk reducing effect / Low cost
- High risk reducing effect / Medium cost
- Medium risk reducing effect / Low cost

Low cost-effect
- Medium risk reducing effect / Medium cost
- High risk reducing effect / High cost
- Low risk reducing effect / Very low cost
- Low risk reducing effect / Low cost

Very low cost-effect
- Medium risk reducing effect / High cost
- Low risk reducing effect / Medium cost
- Low risk reducing effect / High cost

Fields.Name: costeffectjustification
Fields.Label: Justification
Fields.PlaceholderText: Please enter justification for change for the measure
Fields.Description:
When the state of the measure is changed, it is important to document the background or reasoning for the change of state for the measure, e.g. why it is decided to implement a new (suggested) measure or not. The text needs to reflect what has actually been performed, and needs to be easily understandable for everybody.

If a measure is decided to be implemented, it is important to document how the measure has been implemented. This could for example be related to the solution for the measure itself, or it could be that the measure is followed up through other existing systems such as the management system or the maintenance program. In some cases, it may be useful to enter a link to further documentation describing how the measure has been solved, e.g. link to where to find drawing, report, procedure.

The documentation of change should always start with the date of change and the initials of the person making the change, before documenting the actual change performed and the background for the change.

An example could be:

DD.MM.YYYY - NN: Suggested -> Cancelled. This measure is considered to be in conflict with other measures already decided for implementation, and is therefore decided not to be implemented.

Zooms.Description: Risk treatment involves deciding which measures shall be implemented to mitigate risk. The risk treatment shall be performed with the involvement of the person(s) responsible for managing the risk(s). Several people may participate in the process of discussing and deciding how a risk shall be treated, but it is the person(s) responsible for managing the risk who shall decide which measures that shall be implemented.

Risk treatment involves deciding which measures shall be implemented to mitigate risk. The risk treatment shall be performed with the involvement of the person(s) responsible for managing the risk(s). Several people may participate in the process of discussing and deciding how a risk shall be treated, but it is the person(s) responsible for managing the risk who shall decide which measures that shall be implemented.

Risk treatment involves deciding which measures shall be implemented to mitigate risk. The risk treatment shall be performed with the involvement of the person(s) responsible for managing the risk(s). Several people may participate in the process of discussing and deciding how a risk shall be treated, but it is the person(s) responsible for managing the risk who shall decide which measures that shall be implemented.

Risk treatment involves deciding which measures shall be implemented to mitigate risk. The risk treatment shall be performed with the involvement of the person(s) responsible for managing the risk(s). Several people may participate in the process of discussing and deciding how a risk shall be treated, but it is the person(s) responsible for managing the risk who shall decide which measures that shall be implemented.

Metadata.Name: Risk Assessment
Metadata.Description: This is the most awesome template for doing stuff

Fields.Name: subtitle
Fields.Label: All your ongoing measures in UXRisk

Fields.Name: linkto
Fields.Label: Click here to view as web page

Fields.Name: content1
Fields.Label: This is a reminder of the following measure(s) you are allocated and have accepted. It is your responsibility to follow up and implement measure(s) within the specified due date.

Fields.Name: content2
Fields.Label: Please update the status and add a comment related to what has been done since last update.

Fields.Name: subtitle
Fields.Label: Sombody assigned a new measure to you

Fields.Name: linkto
Fields.Label: Click here to view as web page

Fields.Name: content1
Fields.Label: As part of our risk management process you have been assigned the following measure(s). Can you please assess the following measure(s) and accept or decline the responsibility for implementing these measures within the given due date?

Fields.Name: content2
Fields.Label: Please add a comment if a measure is declined. If you decline a measure due for example to impractical due date, a different person should be responsible, or a better description is needed, etc., please provide the reason and alternative suggestions within the comment field.

Fields.Name: linkto
Fields.Label: Click here to view as web page
